header.title: ESOTERIC EXTENSION OF TAROT TO DEVELOP SUPERSENSORY POWERS

central_thesis: The text posits that creative imagination, understood as the 'Mother Principle' derived from Qabalistic teachings, is the fundamental force behind the universe's manifestation and the key to developing supersensory powers. By consciously understanding and directing this power, individuals can evolve into conscious co-creators with the Divine.

structure_content.chapter_title: Lesson 16: Creative Imagination and the Empress
structure_content.summary: This lesson introduces Tarot Key No. 3, The Empress, as representing the power of creative imagination. It explains that the universe itself is a product of the Creator's imagination. The author addresses the common perception of the world's imperfections, attributing it to humanity's limited perspective. It emphasizes the importance of recognizing this limitation to avoid negative emotions like anxiety and anger. The lesson then links conscious creative imagination to supersensory perception, distinguishing it from uncontrolled 'psychism' and highlighting the goal of controlled, summonable powers. The 'Mother Principle' from Qabalah is introduced as the feminine aspect of the Divine responsible for creative imagination, contrasting it with the often-neglected maternal aspect of God in Western thought.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Mother Principle and Emotional Security
structure_content.summary: The text elaborates on the 'Mother Principle' (Binah/Aima in Qabalah) as the formative element in creative imagination. It connects this principle to the profound impact of the mother image on a person's emotional security and highlights how unresolved emotional conflicts with the mother can impede spiritual growth. An anecdotal experience of an 'apport' (a physical object appearing spontaneously) is shared as a manifestation of the Cosmic Mother's influence and a personal message, illustrating the tangible results of higher creative powers.

The lesson re-emphasizes that true creative imagination stems from a higher source, not solely from individual will, as evidenced by the apport. It defines consciousness as the creator of the universe, viewing the universe as a mental image in the mind of God. The importance of understanding one's own consciousness, including the emotional nature as a driving force, is stressed. The connection between the Empress and the Emperor (representing the union of feminine and masculine principles) is discussed, with the Empress symbolizing the womb and the gateway for all things. The ability to produce apports is presented not just as a rare psychic phenomenon but as a result of consciously dissolving and reconstructing molecular structures through focused mental imagery, a skill attainable beyond Masters of Wisdom.

structure_content.chapter_title: Developing Positive Imagery and the Self-Image
structure_content.summary: The text warns against merely forcing positive thoughts, as this can create resistance. True development requires understanding the actual principles of consciousness and how they interrelate. The importance of intensifying alert awareness and image-making powers is highlighted, along with observing one's subconscious processes. The lesson introduces Wisdom and Folly as the opposing forces related to this Tarot Key, emphasizing that wise creation comes from proper imagery. It revisits the maternal aspect of God and its significance in developing positive mental relationships with the female principle. The concept of the soul's self-image as a magnetic matrix that attracts physical substance for manifestation is introduced, explaining similarities across incarnations and the potential to change one's form by reforming the self-image.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Nature of Beauty and Divine Creativity
structure_content.summary: The final section discusses the illusion of external beauty, asserting that true beauty is subjective and arises from our response and creative imagination. It encourages readers to project the concept of beauty onto life and pay attention to the self-images of Mother Nature. The lesson concludes by urging the reader to embrace the intricate forms, colors, and textures of the universe, seeing them as expressions of Divine creativity, and thereby learning to partake in the 'nourishing beauty of the Divine'.

key_concepts.definition: The fundamental power by which the universe is manifested, originating from the Divine Creator. In esoteric teaching, it is linked to Tarot Key No. 3, The Empress, and is understood as the 'Mother Principle' in Qabalah. It is the ability to consciously co-create and manifest reality.

A Qabalistic concept, often represented by Binah or Aima, symbolizing the Divine Feminine that is the formative element in creative imagination and the universe's manifestation. It is contrasted with the masculine principle and is presented as essential for understanding the genesis of life and consciousness.

Powers beyond the ordinary senses, often referred to as 'psychism'. The text distinguishes between uncontrolled, potentially problematic 'psychism' and controlled supersensory perception, which can be summoned at will and turned off. Developing this controlled ability is a primary goal of the course.

The text presents consciousness as the primary creative force in the universe, stating that 'consciousness creates, and the universe is a mental image in the mind of God.' Understanding and directing one's own consciousness is crucial for proper creation.

A phenomenon where a physical object spontaneously appears. The text uses an apport of a figurine as an example of manifestations of higher creative powers, suggesting it's an aspect of dissolving and recreating molecular structure through focused mental imagery, achievable through conscious direction of consciousness.

An internal, often subconscious, image or matrix of oneself, which influences personality and physical form. The text suggests that this image, which can be electromagnetic in nature, is crucial for attracting physical substance and manifests across incarnations. Changing the self-image is presented as a way to change one's personality and potentially one's physical form.

The opposing principles associated with Tarot Key No. 3. Wisdom involves holding proper imagery and knowing how to create positively, while Folly is characterized by flawed imagery and unwise creation, leading to frustration.

practical_system.description: The practical system outlined involves understanding and consciously directing one's creative imagination, viewed as the 'Mother Principle' and a facet of Divine consciousness. Key practices include: 1. Recognizing and accepting the limitation of human perspective to avoid negative emotions. 2. Cultivating controlled supersensory perception, distinct from uncontrolled 'psychism'. 3. Developing a positive and accurate self-image, understanding its role in manifestation. 4. Understanding the principles of consciousness and how thought and emotion combine to create reality. 5. Applying focused mental imagery, analogous to how the universe is created and how apports are formed. 6. Projecting a concept of beauty and appreciating the creative expressions of Nature. The underlying philosophy is that by aligning one's consciousness with the Divine creative principle, one can achieve greater evolution and mastery over the manifested world.
tools: Emotional Nature (as a driving force for creation)

relevant_quotes.text: The universe has come forth by means of the imagining of the Creator, so that everything in the universe that we can see, and everything in the universe that we do not see, everything that manifests at any time or any place, is said to be the result of the imagination of the Lord of Life.
Our consciousness is limited, therefore, the data upon which we base our judgment is incomplete.
What we should seek is controlled supersensory perception which can be summoned at will and as quickly turned off.
Our whole inner subconscious relationship to the mother concept holds the secret to our emotional security!
Consciousness imagines, therefore consciousness creates; and it is only as you learn to understand your own consciousness that you create properly.
The power to produce apports is not limited to Masters of Wisdom.
We must learn to understand the actual principles of consciousness and how they work and how they interrelate in all their ramifications.
Change your self image and you change your personality.
True beauty is in the eye of the beholder. When we think that something is beautiful from an external appearance, this is the greatest illusion. Real beauty comes from our response to it.

critical_analysis.relevance: This text is highly relevant to practitioners of Western Esotericism, particularly those interested in Tarot, Qabalah, and the development of consciousness and psychic abilities. It bridges classical esoteric concepts with modern psychological understanding, offering a framework for self-evolution and conscious creation that aligns with Hermetic principles like 'As Above, So Below' and the power of mental causation.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience includes students of Ann Davies' teachings, practitioners of Tarot and Qabalah, occultists seeking to understand the nature of consciousness and manifestation, and individuals interested in developing their latent psychic or supersensory abilities through a structured, philosophically grounded approach.
